Artwork Caption: I hail from international waters with Chinese, Filipino, and Spanish blood. My tropical exotic mix has taught me to be conversational in Spanish, and to have an ear for Brazilian Portuguese. My career began in 2013 as a professional BDSM player at a local dungeon in Los Angeles, and created a solid foundation for my knowledge of Bondage, Discipline, Dominance, Submission, and Sado-Masochism. As a Dominant, my greatest joy is watching you transform into the most humble and genuine submissive with PURPOSE.
Credits: Written + Directed by Domina Mara, featuring sub AV, filmed in collaboration with Love as a Fetish.

Artwork Caption: Were you aware that there is such a thing as a leopard x lion mix?  This Panthera Hybrid is named a Leopon.  My solar + lunar signs are Leo, the Lion, and my birth month is August.  The dress I chose to represent my sensual, sleek feline attributes was a satin leopard print with a matching pair of designer sunglasses to add mystery.  I added leather gloves + shoes to accompany the outfit as well as a sharp crop, to ensure a stinging bite.

As seen in Ancient Greek Mythology, the Owl is Athena’s sacred animal for Her unparalleled intelligence, war stratagems, and innovation of crafty tools. In this introductory short film, Goddess Mara has embodied this bird of prey to showcase Her skills as a flow artist, fire dancer, and character performer. Silk fans, fire fans, fire torches, a parasol, and isis wings are combined with dance to create a narrative of how Her existence has ensnared mankind.
Credits: Written + Directed by Domina Mara, featuring Silvio A, filmed by Landon Donoho

Artwork Caption: Garnet is the January birth stone and the crimson, pink, gold, and green colors are a nice bridge from the holiday season.  Red is also a symbol for good luck and happiness in Chinese culture.  This calendar year celebrates the year of the dog in the Chinese Zodiac, hence my guard pup~  This is a story on how the Mistress lead us form the garden into the building, up the hotel, and into a room where the sensuality can finally occur behind closed doors…

This metaphorical series is dedicated to Mother’s Day and the quality time our Mommys have given to us since our innocent birth to help nurture us into who we are today.  Since I also choose not to have any children of My own, My submissives are who I care for.

I was given a K9 mask, collar, and leash by Stockroom Design to create a kinky concept and came up with a weekend playing with My pup in the poppy fields during the Superbloom. **NO FLOWERS WERE HARMED - all fields are photoshopped over trails**
Credits: Visual Concept + Editing by Domina Mara, featuring Fetish Fellow, shot by AV.

Artwork Caption: Through this performance score, I want to explore what it means to be uncoupled; what exactly constructs a union if that union isn’t ratified by the state? If we aren’t interested in engaging in a marital agreement for the purpose of obtaining property, nor for the heterosexual bio-utility of production, then divorce isn’t about loss, because there was no property in the first place. Divorce becomes a celebration, an empty space from which the next evolution can take place; the uncoupling is the release from the container, a choreographed event of care, a maintenance of intimacy via deconstruction
Credits: Photos by Junior Fernandez, featuring Anastasia Vayner

Artwork Caption: The performance of a union >> “During this hour of consciousness, the couple has requested to be collected into a membrane all unto themselves, a cocoon  to identify this instance of union and desire, and to give their present a formlessness, from which could emerge all possible forms.”
Credits: Photos by Ursula Barker, featuring Anastasia Vayner

Artwork Caption: E-Viction is a virtual arthouse / whore gallery event that existed for 12 hours before self-destructing. Log on and be seduced by our virtual peepshow where you’ll have intimate encounters with sex workers and artists making art and sex live on cam. Scroll through performers’ ads, shop art and sex objects at our E-Banned shop, learn about legislation that threatens sex workers and free speech online, join raunchy chat rooms, and protest digital gentrification. But be sure to tune in before it’s all gone at midnight. E-Viction is the only deplatforming you can prepare for in advance.
Credits: Crew: Aarati Akkapeddi, Rena Li, Minxy Lopez, Samone, Urzulka, Abe, Shayla Lange, Lady Euphoria, Yves, Olive. E-Viction is produced by Veil Machine as part of the 2020 Rapid Response residency at Eyebeam and supported by Kink Out Events.

Unbound explores the inheritance of ancestral trauma. My great-great grandmother was the last woman in my family to have bound feet. At age four (the same age when girls begin the process of foot-binding), I spent six months living in my ancestral home in Kaiping, China, where I suffered a fracture to my left foot. I solicit men via Craigslist and Tinder for anonymous “foot worship” sessions in which they pay to rub, kiss, and lick my feet. I construct an altar to my great-great grandmother and invite audience members to sit with me inside a circle of rice and to trade foot massages as we share stories of family pain. Performed at performance space, Folkestone, UK, October 2019.

In “Starfire”, I use menstruation as the basis for a feminist reenactment of the Holy Eucharist. I appear as the Scarlet Woman, who transforms the profane into the sacred by reimagining religious rituals from a feminist perspective.

Nurture presents motherhood as a durational performance and as an act of love and labor. In the role of the archetypal Mother, the artist offers her empathy and her body to the audience in an intimate, one-on-one interaction. Holding participants in her arms so that they may suckle from her breast, she plays a soundtrack of lullabies sung by mothers in different languages, while inviting them to discuss their thoughts about their mothers or motherhood. Performed at Tempting Failure Biennial of Performance Art and Noise, London, UK, July 2018.
Credits: Collaborators: Molly Caitlin Baber & Jack Murphy

Artwork Caption: Rope, fire, blood, earth, wood, water, wax, metal. Audience members write down their fears and sins on slips of paper, which are tucked under ropes that bind my body. The papers are read aloud and burned as the artists shed their blood in a cleansing ritual. Performed at Gelegenheiten, Berlin, Germany, March 2019.
Credits:
Collaborators: Zarahlena
Cristina Söderström Martos
Chandler Barnes (ropes/piercing)
Bommi Pelletiér (music)

Artwork Caption: In collaboration with Red Canary Song, a grassroots organization which advocates and provides resources for Asian and migrant sex workers, I organized a ritual and temporary altar to honor a massage worker who died during a NYPD raid. The site was 302 Broome St, a former Asian massage parlor.

In “Starfire”, I use menstruation as the basis for a feminist reenactment of the Holy Eucharist. I appear as the Scarlet Woman, who transforms the profane into the sacred by reimagining religious rituals from a feminist perspective.

A participatory online performance featuring an all-sex worker cast and crew which utilized audience members’ data as a form of intimacy and political critique. The multilayered performance begins at the first point of contact with our website (www.play4usnow.com), where users submit personal preferences and answer security questions in return for an invitation to the "data dungeon". Using the aesthetics of the underground BDSM dungeon and employing real-life sex workers impacted by data policy, the project engaged viewers to critically consider their experience of digital surveillance and privacy.

Dia Dynasty is Chantico.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              She wears red and reaps Pleasure and Pain. Radiant Serpentine Grace. She Who Dwells in the House. Goddess of Fire and War. Guardian of animals, metals and minerals, Her Domain. She takes possession of Her Offering and makes Her mark on him, binding his soul to Her promise of protection and power.

You are entering The Chamber.                                                                                                                                                                                 When you are entering The Chamber your profane world is left behind.
You are now in an alternative universe,  where your obscure desires and fantasies become realiaty.
Are you ready?
Credits: Collaboration with Marcelle Marais and Sheena.                                                                                                                                            Wardrobe Tableaux Vivants.

Artwork Caption:
Human Flesh

She was a a doomed angel with more love for humanity than even her immortal body could contain. Daily she would listen to the reverence of humankind and shower it with her otherworldly affection. On the day she burst, she could no longer hear their prayers. They had forgotten her. She condemned those mortals, and shed her ethereal form to reveal the fanatical, vengeful creature beneath. She could not die, so she traipsed the surface of the earth, wailing, mourning humankind’s unrequited love.

She was monstrous.
Credits: Collaboration with Kathryn Kane. Wardrobe Lasegue.falret.

How the body is viewed informs us on the ways that the dynamics of power alter relationships between people and the individual’s object-subject-hood. Objectification is often a process that female bodies are subjected to, losing agency and empathy in the process. By abstracting and deconstructing the male form, I remove its usual role as “subject,” allowing for a new context in which to view the male body.

I'm interested in re-contextualizing the narratives of sexual labor. Here, the only body visible is of the (presumed) client, headless, anonymous, but offering a brief glimpse into a moment of intimacy through the eyes of a sex worker. A visual shift in the cultural script of sexual commerce.

“...If you want to know the truth, I’m a virgin. I really am. I’ve had quite a few opportunities to lose my virginity and all, but I’ve never got around to it yet…The thing is, most of the time when you’re coming pretty close to doing it with a girl—a girl that isn’t a prostitute or anything, I mean—she keeps telling you to stop. The trouble with me is, I stop. Most guys don’t. I can’t help it.”

Artwork Caption: Everyone talks about nightmares, but what about the erotic anxiety we experience during the day?

daymares:: the fantasy being better than the reality, someone is so wrong they are right, or, so right they are wrong, fearing loss of interest, the gray areas of desire, feeling unsure, complex decisions, trauma bonding, monotony and the in-between, what will it be like after the quarantine..these are daymares.

At times of social distancing we are struggling with the dystopia idea, that we may not be as connected as we once were. This is a solar punk vision of what types of relationships we will form in our future lives<^>
